comments.body: There is several Redstone machines that make good use of them not breaking apart, but I would like to see an option that you can place in crafting 2X2 or 3X3 and break them apart

I suggest that the Minecart with Block items be given the same property as the Bucket of Fluid items.


So that, you may take the Block out of a Minecart with Block via crafting result,

and the Minecart is returned to you empty just like how a Bucket is when used as an ingredient.

The change to stop minecarts from dropping chests and hoppers seems a bit ironic now that the Crafter exists. It seems like originally we asked for "Minecart with X" to stop breaking into component parts because re-crafting them was a pain.

Now we have the opposite problem where it would be easy to re-craft them but we have no way to break them apart.
just get a trident with loyalty dude

well if this was added it should have it so that sometimes it hits you.

or misses you and lands somewhere else
It might be in the savannah update in the future.

The ability to hit a mob twice with one throw if you throw it right could be nice, I enjoy using boomerangs in games.

It also could have the niche of being the weakest projectile weapon on each individual hit, but much easier to obtain than a trident, and not requiring separate ammo like a bow/crossbow. A skilled player could still craft several boomerangs and deftly alternate between using them to make up for the lack of power.

The Boomerang should be able to be thrown to get dropped loot or other items including xp and bring all of it back to you.  Throwing the boomerang should take durability points when it connects with an object or player.  Boomerangs can be enchanted similarly to a sword, especially with knockback, mending, and unbreaking.

the log should be dark gray
and the tree that gives more shadow
and it gives you more shoots

it grows better in the lakes or swamps

Either dark gray or white would be cool, although I think birch is already white enough for me, so my vote is for dark gray. It would go great with modern builds. Maybe the tree could be unique in that it only generates naturally up to a certain distance from water.

Other idea: mangrove trees that only grow in water. And/or maybe one of the two trees could be the first tree to self-propagate, meaning it could occasionally generate shoots (i.e. saplings) occasionally, which could grow into new trees. If it was mangroves this phenomenon could be limited by water depth.

I think a self-propagating tree could be really cool because it would add an aspect of trees growing after world generation, and players having to "weed out" a species of tree (but it wouldn't get too out of control because it would be limited by either distance from water or water depth).
The bark could be used to make medicine that counteracts potions.
I feel like a dark yellow would fit aesthetically
this is good

More gun powder usage would make gunpowder more useful

I support cannon. and a musket that uses gun powder to shoot bullets which should be iron, copper or lead.
1 ingot required to make 3 bullets - more or less. The musket should be more powerful than the bow and crossbow (so that it feels worth using) but slower to reload so not too overpowered.
We definitely need this

Totally agree with this post.

It just doesn't make sense to not have infinity with mending.

Having just recently returned to this game and finding custom games no longer an option my whole view of playing has changed somewhat but I also understand a lot more about the why of certain mechanics.  Anyway, after just recently fishing up an infinity bow with about 15% health on it, yes I agree with you about the repair costs and should allow mending. 

However, it is at the end of the day, a survival game which means nothing should last forever.  As much as I want my awesome loot and crafted items to last forever that completely goes against the whole spirit of a survival game.  If its was an MMORPG or FPS then yes loot should last forever but a game like this no.  The idea being do I use my really good stuff and wear it down or use the not so good stuff, that I can replace a lot quicker and easier and save the top tier stuff?

Just my thoughts on the matter.  As much as I would love to have infinity and mending on a bow, kinda breaks the survival side.

I have a fully enchanted bow with infinity, punch II, flame, power V, and unbreaking III. The repair first cost will be 9 levels. I used a web app to find the optimal enchantment order. I do think the infinity enchantment name is kind of gimmicky because it can only be used infinitely up until your bow becomes too expensive to repair. It would be more interesting and logical if you have to enchant the single arrow with infinity (would not work on stacks), then enchant your bow with mending.
I agree, Mojang should fix this.

It makes sense to me

Either shoot infinitely until your bow breaks or

shoot until you have no arrows left
My bow said it would take 30 levels to fix last I checked but now that I have the levels I can‚Äôt repair it. So apparently I just lost my last repair for it.
